metadata.title: CVE-2020-15646 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
If an attacker intercepts Thunderbird's initial attempt to performautomatic account setup using the Microsoft Exchange autodiscoverymechanism, and the attacker sends a crafted response, then Thunderbirdsends username and password over https to a server controlled by theattacker. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15646` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
